title: Quiz 1: Principles, Counseling & Assessment
description: Assess your understanding of family planning benefits, the GATHER counseling approach, and patient assessment procedures.

questions.question: Arrange the steps of the GATHER counseling technique in the correct chronological order:
questions.explanation: The GATHER acronym stands for: Greet, Ask, Tell, Help, Explain, and Return.
questions.hint: Start with welcoming the client and end with follow-up planning.

questions.question: According to the medical benefits of family planning, which of the following are benefits specifically for the **mother**? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Protection against unwanted pregnancy and abortion risks
Optimum spacing allows time to nurse the infant
Reduction of anaemia and genital tract cancer
Reduction in malnutrition deaths for under-fives
Avoidance of high-risk pregnancies at extreme ages

questions.explanation: Benefits for the mother include avoiding high-risk pregnancies, reducing abortion risks, and non-contraceptive benefits like reduced anaemia. Benefits B and D are specifically for the *child*.
questions.hint: Focus on the woman's health outcomes, not the child's.

questions.question: Review the Pap Smear Classification table below. What action should be taken for a **Class III** result?

richContent.content:
ClassFinding
Class IIMinor infections
Class IIISuspicious of malignancy
Class VDefinite cancer

options.text: Immediate hysterectomy
Repeat smear in three months and refer for cone biopsy
Treat for Moniliasis or Trichomonas
No action needed, this is normal

questions.explanation: Class III indicates suspicion of malignancy. The protocol is to repeat the smear in three months and refer for a cone biopsy to confirm cancer cells.
questions.hint: This class is 'suspicious' but not yet 'definite' cancer.

questions.question: To rule out pregnancy without a test, a provider can be reasonably sure if the woman is within ___BLANK___ days of the start of her menses or within ___BLANK___ days post-abortion.
questions.explanation: A woman is likely not pregnant if she is within days 1-7 of her menstrual cycle or within 7 days post-abortion.
questions.hint: The number is the same for both scenarios and represents one week.

questions.question: A pelvic examination is mandatory for all clients before initiating hormonal contraceptives like the pill.
questions.explanation: Pelvic examination is seldom necessary except to rule out pregnancy >6 weeks. It is NOT required for initiating pills or injectables, but IS required for IUCDs.
questions.hint: Think about whether pills require checking uterine size.

questions.question: Match the breast examination technique to its description:

pairs.right: Checking size, shape, and dimpling in front of a mirror
Using flat of fingers in a clockwise fashion lying down
Examining up into the hollow of the armpit

questions.explanation: Inspection is visual; Palpation is feeling tissue; Expression checks for discharge; The tail of the breast extends to the axilla.
questions.hint: Match the action verb with the body position or specific check.

questions.question: When should a woman on oral contraceptive pills perform her Self Breast Examination (SBE)?

options.text: Any day of the month
On the day she starts a new packet
During the placebo pill week
Immediately after ovulation

questions.explanation: Women on the pill should perform SBE on the day they start a new packet to ensure consistency.
questions.hint: It coincides with starting a new cycle of medication.

questions.question: What is the term for the process of child spacing so that a couple has the number of children they want at the time desired?
questions.explanation: Family planning is defined as the process of child spacing to achieve desired family size and timing.
questions.hint: This is the main title of the unit.

questions.question: Which of the following are rights of the client in family planning counseling? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Right to privacy and confidentiality
Right to refuse any type of examination
Right to choose which method to use
Right to demand methods that are medically contraindicated

questions.explanation: Clients have rights to privacy, refusal, and choice, but providers guide against medically unsafe choices.
questions.hint: Think about autonomy versus medical safety.

questions.question: What is the primary objective of logistics management in family planning?

options.text: To sell the most expensive contraceptives
To deliver the right product, quantity, and condition to the right place and time
To ensure every clinic has every method available regardless of demand
To maximize profit for the facility

questions.explanation: Logistics aims to deliver the right product, in the right quantity/condition, to the right place, at the right time and cost.
